 "Kosher" actually means proper or correct. For example, you can not mix milk with meat and have it be kosher. So, when there are kosher biscuits , they do not have animal lard and milk in it at the same time. Items that are processed that are kosher basically have been reviewed so that the dietary laws are followed.. 
 
 Families that keep kosher actually keep two sets of dishes.. one for milk dishes, and the other for meat dishes. These are the general rules
 
 

 # Certain animals may not be eaten at all. This restriction includes the flesh, organs, eggs and milk of the forbidden animals.
 # Of the animals that may be eaten, the birds and mammals must be killed in accordance with Jewish law.
 # All blood must be drained from the meat or broiled out of it before it is eaten.
 # Certain parts of permitted animals may not be eaten.
 # Meat (the flesh of birds and mammals) cannot be eaten with dairy. Fish, eggs, fruits, vegetables and grains can be eaten with either meat or dairy. (According to some views, fish may not be eaten with meat).
 # Utensils that have come into contact with meat may not be used with dairy, and vice versa. Utensils that have come into contact with non-kosher food may not be used with kosher food. This applies only where the contact occurred while the food was hot.
 # Grape products made by non-Jews may not be eaten.
